pullRequest.body:
Adds a lemma about when `Fin.cons` is an element of `piFinset`

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

nodes.body: looks like you committed things that are in lake-packages as submodules somehow please remove them
For the show_term golfing, I am confused if you want me to do that for the blocks with rcases. Doing that seems to make the proof longer.

bors d+

I pushed changes that address all my suggestions; if they look ok to you, please merge; otherwise revert the ones you don't like and ping me.

bors d+

I pushed changes that address all my suggestions; if they look ok to you, please merge; otherwise revert the ones you don't like and ping me.

Can you generalize `fun _ => S` here to `S : Fin n → Finset α`? I think that gives
```suggestion
    Fin.cons x p ∈ Fintype.piFinset (fun _ => S) ↔ x ∈ S 0 ∧ p ∈ Fintype.piFinset (fun i => S i.succ) := by
```
Ok will do
Actually I thought it looked asymmetrical to have cons on the LHS but not the right, so I split into two versions, one with cons and one without.
Can you add the `Fin.snoc` lemma too for good measure?
Ok done, but I had to add API to do it, so the PR now touches Fin.Basic

`fun i => S i` is just `S`!
```suggestion
    p ∈ Fintype.piFinset S ↔ p 0 ∈ S 0 ∧ Fin.tail p ∈ Fintype.piFinset (Fin.tail S) := by
```

I guess this probably generalizes to
```suggestion
lemma Fin.succ_mem_piFinset_iff {n : ℕ} {α : Fin (n + 1) → Type*} (p : ∀ i, α i) (S : ∀ i, Finset (α i)) :
```
Does the proof go through without modification?
I'm getting a lot of "failed to synthesize instance Membership"
Err, wait I mistyped, sorry
Yeah it goes through

```suggestion
    p ∈ Fintype.piFinset S ↔ p 0 ∈ S 0 ∧ Fin.tail p ∈ Fintype.piFinset (Fin.tail S) := by
```
I dont think these brackets are needed

```suggestion
    (∃ j : Fin n, i = j.castSucc) ∨ i = last n := by
```
shouldnt be needed

Did you mean
```suggestion
lemma Fin.snoc_mem_piFinset_snoc_iff {α} {n : ℕ} (p : Fin n → α) (x : α)
```

There's not really anything happening here, can it be golfed:
```suggestion
  · exact fun ha_1 ↦ ⟨ha_1 0, fun a_1 ↦ ha_1 (Fin.succ a_1)⟩
```
(untested)
(and similarly in several places below)

I think `succ` should appear later in the name, and we should use the new notation for dependent functions (which I find much easier to read). Also we should consistently indent by 4 spaces.
```suggestion
lemma Fin.mem_piFinset_succ_iff {n : ℕ} {α : Fin (n + 1) → Type*} (p : (i : Fin (n + 1)) → α i)
    (S : (i : Fin (n + 1)) → Finset (α i)) :
```
(and similarly in various lemmas below)

```suggestion
theorem eq_castSucc_or_eq_last {n : Nat} (i : Fin (n + 1)) :
    (∃ j : Fin n, i = j.castSucc) ∨ i = last n := by
  obtain ⟨i : ℕ, hi : i < n + 1⟩ := i
```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (S : ∀ i, Finset (α i)) : ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (S₀ : Finset α) (Sᵢ : Fin n → Finset α) : ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (S : ∀ i, Finset (α i)) : ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (Sᵢ : Fin n → Finset α) (Sₙ : Finset α) : ```
This looks like an induction principle in disguise to me.
Indeed, this is `Fin.reverseInduction`

You can prove this with
```
  induction i using reverseInduction with
  | last => right; rfl
  | cast n => left; exact ⟨_, rfl⟩
```
but instead you should just delete this lemma.

```suggestion
    induction a1 using Fin.reverseInduction
    · exact h2
    · exact h1 _
```

This generalizes:
```suggestion
@[simp]
lemma Fin.cons_mem_piFinset_cons_iff {n : ℕ} {α : Fin (n + 1) → Type*}
    (x : α 0) (xs : (i : Fin _) → α i.succ)
    (S₀ : Finset (α 0)) (Sᵢ : (i : Fin n) → Finset (α i.succ)) :
    Fin.cons x xs ∈ Fintype.piFinset (Fin.cons S₀ Sᵢ) ↔ x ∈ S₀ ∧ xs ∈ Fintype.piFinset Sᵢ := by
  simp_rw [Fin.mem_piFinset_succ_iff, cons_zero, tail_cons]
```
